title: 23-year-old drowns in hotel swimming pool in Katana
byline: A 23-year-old youth has died after drowning in a hotel swimming pool in the Kandawala area of Katana.

title: Woman arrested for illegal excavation in Ethimale
byline: A female suspect engaged in the illegal excavation of artifacts in the Gemunupura area, within the Ethimale Police Division, has been arrested along with excavation equipment.

title: Showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology said that the prevailing showery and windy conditions over the southwestern parts of the island are expected to continue.

title: President to leave for US today to attend UN General Assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to leave for the United States today (22).

title: Gazette issued declaring services related electricity supply as essential public services
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette notification has been issued by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, declaring all services connected to the supply of electricity as essential public services.

title: Portugal formally recognises Palestinian state, minister says
byline: Portugal’s Foreign Affairs Minister Paulo Rangel announced on Sunday that the country has now recognised the state of Palestine.

title: Singer Harry Styles runs Berlin Marathon in under 3 hours
byline: English singer and songwriter Harry Styles ran the Berlin Marathon in under three hours on Sunday (Sep 21).

title: Woman arrested at Jaffna airport while attempting to smuggle gold into Sri Lanka
byline: A 41-year-old Sri Lankan woman has been apprehended at the Jaffna International Airport for attempting to smuggle gold into the country.

title: Speaker endorses certificate on National Audit (Amendment) Bill
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (22) endorsed the certificate on the National Audit (Amendment) Bill.

title: Southern politicians linked to drug and organized crime networks – Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala has claimed that certain politicians in the Southern Province are allegedly connected to drug trafficking and organized criminal networks.

title: Process of assigning CEB employees to four newly established companies commences
byline: The process of assigning employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to four newly established, fully state-owned companies — established under the implementation of the Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Act — has now officially commenced, the Ministry of Energy stated.

title: CEB employee arrested for providing lodging to Sampath Manamperi
byline: A Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) employee has been arrested by the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) for allegedly providing accommodation to Sampath Manamperi, who is currently in remand in connection with the discovery of a buried container of chemicals used in manufacturing ‘Ice’ drugs in Middeniya.

title: President Dissanayake to undertake an official visit to Japan
byline: At the invitation of the Government of Japan, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will undertake an Official Visit to Japan from September 27-30, 2025.

title: EPF Mobile Service Week to begin today in Jaffna
byline: The Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) Mobile Service Week, organized by the Ministry of Labor, is scheduled to commence today (22).

title: Court rejects Shasheendra’s bail appeal, further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa,  has been further remanded until September 30 after the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court rejected his bail application today (22), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Tens of thousands join pro-Palestinian demos, strikes in Italy
byline: Tens of thousands of people protested on Monday across Italy as part of a day of action to “denounce the genocide in Gaza”, which included transport strikes and port blockades.

title: India’s Chief of Naval Staff visits Sri Lanka to strengthen maritime ties
byline: Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi, Chief of the Naval Staff of India, is on a four-day official visit to Sri Lanka from September 22 to September 25, according to an official statement from the Ministry of Defence.

title: Naked body of man washes ashore at beach in Moratuwa
byline: A naked body was discovered washed ashore at the Jayagathpura Beach in Modara, within the Moratuwa-Egoda Uyana police division, this morning (22), the police said.

title: Indian Court dismisses Jacqueline Fernandez’s plea in money laundering case
byline: The Supreme Court of India on Monday refused to interfere with a Delhi High Court order dismissing actor Jacqueline Fernandez’s plea to quash ECIR (equivalent to FIR) in a Rs 200 crore money laundering case involving alleged conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar.

title: Police issues clarification regarding letter circulating on social media
byline: Sri Lanka Police says a letter currently circulating on social media, claiming to have been issued under the signature of the Inspector General of Police, is completely false and fabricated.

title: Hearing of case against Yoshitha and his grandmother adjourned
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Attorney General against Yoshitha Rajapaksa, son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and his grandmother, Daisy Forrest, over the alleged unlawful acquisition of assets worth approximately Rs. 73 million, be recalled on October 15.

title: China says it is combating ‘malicious’ content in two-month social media crackdown
byline: China’s top internet regulator announced on Monday a sweeping two-month crackdown on social media, vowing to combat content containing “malicious incitement of conflict” and “negative outlooks on life such as world-weariness”.

title: “There will be no Palestine state”: Benjamin Netanyahu to UK, Canada, Australia
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu strongly opposed the UK, Canada, and Australia’s move to recognise Palestine and said that there will be no Palestinian state to the west of the Jordan River.

title: Tom Holland suffers injury on ‘Spider-Man’ set, filming halted
byline: Filming of Spider-Man: Brand New Day has been paused by the makers following Tom Holland’s injury on the set of the film.

title: Lachlan Murdoch, Michael Dell, Ellison involved in TikTok deal, Trump says
byline: President Donald Trump said on Sunday that media mogul Lachlan Murdoch and business leaders Larry Ellison and Michael Dell would be involved as U.S. investors in a proposed deal to keep TikTok operating in the United States.

title: Over 10kg of ‘Ice’ seized from Seenimodara house where 2 bodies were found
byline: Police have recovered over 10 kilograms of narcotics substance suspected to be crystal methamphetamine (‘ICE’) from the house under renovation in Seenimodara, where two bodies were previously discovered, police said.

title: President rules out privatization of power sector
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has firmly stated that the present government remains consistently committed to safeguarding Sri Lanka’s energy sovereignty, and that there is no intention at any time to hand over the electricity sector to private entities.

title: Sri Lankan anglers join fight against invasive giant snakehead fish
byline: Nissanka Arachchige Vimukthi Sandaruwan beat more than 1,000 anglers to become champion of a unique competition to protect native fish from invasive giant snakehead fish in central Sri Lanka.

title: Educational reforms to focus on activity-based learning and religious education: PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that one of the key objectives of the ongoing education reforms is to increase the focus on activity-based learning in schools.

title: Hearing of case against ex-MP Sajin Vass postponed to Dec.
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (22) has ordered former Parliamentarian Sajin Vass Gunawardena to file a written submission on December 16, if he has any reasons for failing to pay income tax amounting to nearly Rs. 36.9 million.

title: Israel bolsters military presence over Jewish New Year holiday period
byline: The Israeli military said on Monday that it had reinforced air, land and naval forces across the country during the upcoming holiday period following a “multi-front assessment”.

title: New details emerge on bodies found in renovated house in Seenimodara
byline: New details have come to light regarding the bodies of two males discovered inside a partially renovated house in Seenimodara, Tangalle.

title: UK considers plan to scrap visa fees for top global talent: Report
byline: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer is exploring proposals to abolish some visa fees for top global talent at a time when the United States has taken a tougher stance on immigration, the Reuters News Agency on Monday.

title: 245kg of heroin, 380kg of ICE and six weapons recovered in Tangalle today - Police
byline: A total of 245 kilogram of heroin and 380 kilogram of crystal methamphetamine or commonly known as ‘Ice’ have been recovered from three lorries in Tangalle today (22), police stated.

title: Hong Kong airport to shut for 36 hours due to Typhoon Ragasa
byline: Hong Kong International Airport will suspend all passenger flights for 36 hours from Tuesday (Sep 23) evening, Qantas Airways said, as the Asian financial hub prepares for one of its strongest super typhoons in years.

title: World summit to meet on two-state solution as support grows for Palestinian state
byline: France and Saudi Arabia will convene dozens of world leaders on Monday to rally support for a two-state solution, with several of them expected to formally recognise a Palestinian state - a move that could draw harsh Israeli and U.S. responses.

title: Two bodies recovered from Tangalle house under renovation
byline: Police have recovered two bodies from an old house currently being renovated in the Seenimodara area of Tangalle.

title: ASPI closes at new all-time high today
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 141.78 points today (22).

title: Weapons & ammunition belonging to Sampath Manamperi found in Middeniya
byline: Police have recovered a 9mm pistol, two T-56 magazines, 115 rounds of T-56 ammunition, and a hand grenade, suspected to belong to Sampath Manamperi.

title: Another lorry with 200kg of substances believed to be ‘Ice’ and heroin found in Tangalle
byline: A large stock of narcotics, including over 200 kilograms of crystal methamphetamine or commonly known as ‘Ice’ and heroin, has been discovered in Seenimodara, Tangalle, authorities confirmed.

title: Lorry carrying 200 kg of ‘Ice’ and heroin seized in Tangalle
byline: A lorry transporting around 200 kilograms of crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as Ice) and heroin was seized in Tangalle, said police.

title: Trump hails Charlie Kirk as ‘American hero’ as thousands fill memorial service
byline: US President Donald Trump hailed the conservative activist Charlie Kirk as a “great American hero” and “martyr” during a speech to tens of thousands of mourners at a memorial service in Arizona.

title: EU cyber agency says airport software held to ransom by criminals
byline: The EU’s cyber security agency says criminals are using ransomware to cause chaos in airports around the world.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation climbs to 1.5% in August
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has increased to 1.5% in August 2025, compared to 0.7% in July 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: CEB trade unions to continue work-to-rule campaign until Wednesday
byline: All trade unions affiliated to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have decided to continue their ongoing work-to-rule trade union action until Wednesday (24).

title: President leaves for US to attend UN General Assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake left the island a short while ago to the USA to attend the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Full report on tragic Ella bus crash handed over to Transport Minister
byline: The full report on the tragic accident in Ella recently, which claimed the lives of 16 individuals, has been handed over to Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake.

title: Chief of Staff of Indian Navy meets Navy Commander
byline: Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi, the Chief of Naval Staff of the Indian Navy, who is in Sri Lanka on a four-day official visit, met with the Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy, Vice Admiral Kanchana Banagoda at the Navy Headquarters in Colombo today.

title: Temple elephant ‘Kadira’ reportedly attacks mahout – victim hospitalised
byline: ‘Kadira’, an elephant belonging to the elephant troop of the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy, has reportedly attacked its mahout.

title: One injured in accident on Southern Expressway – Lane towards Colombo blocked
byline: An individual has been injured in an accident that occurred tonight (22) between Dodangoda and Gelanigama exits on the Southern Expressway.
